author: N Dinesh Nayak
text:
Minister for Social Welfare H. Anjaneya has announced a Rs. 55.35-crore special package for the overall development of the Siddi tribe of Uttara Kannada district.

Speaking to presspersons in Karwar on Friday, Mr. Anjaneya said while some of the works incorporated in the package were being implemented in the Siddi tribal locations, the remaining amount would be released after the coming budget.

The plan is to implement all welfare schemes under the special package within one year, he added. To ensure access for education to the Siddi children, the government will open a residential school at Vada.

Besides, two new residential schools, modelled on the lines of the Navodaya residential schools, will be opened in Yellapur and Haliyal, and nearly 70 per cent of the seats would be reserved for Siddi children in these schools.

The government had released Rs. 5 crore to provide drinking water, streetlights and other such amenities, and Rs. 2.5 crore to construct 150 houses, he said.

Mr. Anjaneya stopped at the house of a tribal family in Vada village and celebrated the New Year with them. Mr. Anjaneya said he visited the village to get first-hand information about the implementation of government welfare schemes for the Siddis.

H. Anjaneya,Minister for Social Welfare

title: Rs. 55.35-cr. special package for Siddi tribe
